block.p: Elizabeth Fogarty Garno, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edmund Forsythe Garno Jr. of Gladwyne, Pa., was married on Friday evening to William Rogers Reid, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Ogden Rogers Reid of Waccabuc, N.Y. The Rev. James L. Burns performed the ceremony at the Episcopal Church of the Heavenly Rest in New York.

Mrs. Reid graduated from Brown University. She received a master's degree in developmental psychology from Columbia University. In September, she is to begin studying there for a doctorate in clinical psychology. Her father is a partner in Trion, employee-benefits consultants in Philadelphia. Her mother, Patricia Garno, is a board member of Philadelphia Hospitality, an organization that provides cultural programs.

Elizabeth Fogarty Garno, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edmund Forsythe Garno Jr. of Gladwyne, Pa., was married on Friday evening to William Rogers Reid, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Ogden Rogers Reid of Waccabuc, N.Y. The Rev. James L. Burns performed the ceremony at the Episcopal Church of the Heavenly Rest in New York.

Mrs. Reid graduated from Brown University. She received a master's degree in developmental psychology from Columbia University. In September, she is to begin studying there for a doctorate in clinical psychology. Her father is a partner in Trion, employee-benefits consultants in Philadelphia. Her mother, Patricia Garno, is a board member of Philadelphia Hospitality, an organization that provides cultural programs.

Mr. Reid is a partner in Lansdowne Capital, London-based investment advisers, overseeing the New York office. Until February, he was a managing director in corporate finance at Morgan Stanley Dean Witter in New York. He graduated cum laude from Yale University and received an M.B.A. degree from Stanford University.

His father, a former publisher of The New York Herald Tribune, was the ambassador to Israel from 1958 to 1961. He was elected to the House of Representatives, representing Westchester County from 1962 to 1974. He retired as the commissioner of the State Environmental Conservation Department. The bridegroom's mother, Mary Louise Reid, is a fund-raising consultant to nonprofit organizations in New York.
